page.title: 06Village Hall-Hutton-le-Hole
page.content: The Village Hall,opened in 1939,is the social centre for local people.Planned to seat 120, it has a gallery, a fixed stage,a combined kitchen and committee room, a fully equipped billiard room and cloakrooms. The business and the activities of the hall are arranged by a committee. A caretaker is employed. The Women's Institute use it for their monthly meetings. Activities include badminton and billiard clubs, domino drives and dances, both modern and old -time. Concerts are organised in the winter months. The hall can be hired for other functions. The horticultural show, for local villages was held in the hall this year. In October after the harvest, the Mell Supper is served to villagers and friends, followed by dancing.Each Christmas,there is a sale for Hall funds and a family party.This year funds are needed for roof repairs
